description: This technique demonstrates the fundamental steps of securing an armbar from a closed guard position. It focuses on controlling the opponent's posture and arm, climbing the legs to isolate the shoulder, and then extending the hips for the submission.

sequential_diagram_steps.label: Control Arm & Break Posture
sequential_diagram_steps.detail: From closed guard, secure one of the opponent's arms across their centerline by controlling the wrist and pulling their head down towards their chest.

sequential_diagram_steps.label: Climb First Leg & Trap Shoulder
sequential_diagram_steps.detail: Step one foot on the opponent's hip, move your hips out to the side for an angle, and bring the first leg high over their shoulder to trap it.

sequential_diagram_steps.label: Swing Second Leg Over
sequential_diagram_steps.detail: Release your arm control on the opponent's head and swing your second leg over their head, securing both feet crossed on the hip to fully isolate the arm.

sequential_diagram_steps.label: Extend Hips for Submission
sequential_diagram_steps.detail: Slide your hands down towards the opponent's wrist, keeping their arm tight to your chest, and lift your hips to hyperextend the elbow joint for the submission.
